page.title: 01LANDSCAPE AND BUILDINGS.
page.content: The soft rolling countryside in this area of the greenbelt is mostly arable farmland with some mixed woodland.Over half the area is privately owned by the Salisbury Estate and access to this for the public is by the main gate to Hatfield House on the A1000 in Hatfield. Essendon is a picturesque hilltop village surrounded by open countryside. Many of the buildings are listed and during the last hundred years the use of some has changed. St.Mary's church dominates the village centre. The main buildings are the shop,the village hall,the school and the two pubs. Other features are the cricket field and the River Lea which lies at the bottom of the hill. Most people work outside the village and many families have lived in the village for several generations.
